newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian metals firm, no impact over Sumitomo news.
newsitem.headline: Indian metals firm, no impact over Sumitomo news.

text.p: Indian metals held steady on Tuesday showing little impact over news that Tokyo prosecutors had arrested Sumitomo's Yasuo Hamanaka on a forgery charge.
Traders said that according to comments flowing from Sumitomo, it had found no evidence that its former head trader Hamanaka had manipulated the world copper market.
"Industrial demand was low but restricted arrivals of the imported metal kept the market quiet," one dealer said.
Copper and nickel were steady at 11,700 rupees and 37,500, respectively. Aluminium was unchanged at 7,250 rupees, zinc at 6,225 rupees, lead at 4,925 rupees and tin at 35,600 rupees.
